name: squirrel-servers-manager
description: Squirrel Servers Manager is a self-hosted management platform for servers and containers built on Ansible and Docker. It provides a unified GUI to configure, deploy, and monitor infrastructure.
features: Server management: Manages multiple servers from centralized dashboard.
Ansible integration: Executes Ansible playbooks for configuration management.
Docker control: Manages Docker containers and images across servers.
Service monitoring: Tracks service status and resource usage in real-time.
Inventory management: Organizes servers into groups and environments.
Playbook execution: Runs automation tasks with visual playbook builder.
SSH access: Connects to servers via web-based SSH terminal.
File management: Browses and edits files on remote servers.
User permissions: Controls access with role-based permissions for team members.
Scheduled tasks: Automates recurring maintenance with cron-like scheduling.
Audit logs: Records all actions and changes for compliance.
API access: Automates server management via REST API.
